1.verse: The beginning of the good-news of  Jesus Christ, God’s Son

2.verse: As Predicted By Isaiah, John The Baptist Came To Prepare The Way For The Messiah - Just as it has been written in Isaiah the prophet— “Behold, I am sending-forth My messenger ahead of Your presence, who will make Your way ready:

3.verse: A voice of one shouting in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way of the Lord; be making His paths straight’”—

4.verse: John came, the one baptizing in the wilderness and proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

5.verse: And the whole Judean country was going out to him, and all the people-of-Jerusalem. And they were being baptized by him in the Jordan River while confessing-out their sins.

6.verse: And John was dressed-in camel’s hair and a belt made-of-leather around his waist, and was eating locusts and wild honey.

7.verse: And he was proclaiming, saying “The One more powerful than me is coming after me— of Whom I am not fit, having stooped, to untie the strap of His sandals.

8.verse: I baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit”.

9.verse: Jesus Is Baptized By John. God Expresses His Pleasure. Jesus Is Tempted By Satan - And it came about during those days that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was baptized in the Jordan by John.

10.verse: And immediately while ascending out-of the water, He saw the heavens being divided and the Spirit like a dove descending to Him.

11.verse: And a voice came from the heavens— “You are My beloved Son. With You I was well-pleased”.

12.verse: And immediately the Spirit sends Him out into the wilderness.

13.verse: And He was in the wilderness forty days being tempted by Satan. And He was with the wild-beasts. And the angels were ministering to Him.

14.verse: After John Is Arrested, Jesus Comes To Galilee Proclaiming The Good News of God - Now after John was handed-over [to prison], Jesus came to Galilee proclaiming the good-news of God

15.verse: and saying that “The time has been fulfilled, and the kingdom of God has drawn-near. Repent, and put-faith in the good-news”.

16.verse: Jesus Calls The First Disciples - And while passing-by beside the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew (the brother of Simon), casting-a-net in the sea. For they were fishermen.

17.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Come after Me, and I will make you become fishermen of people”.

18.verse: And immediately, having left the nets, they followed Him.

19.verse: And having gone on a little, He saw James (the son of Zebedee) and John (his brother)— they also in their boat, preparing the nets.

20.verse: And immediately He called them. And having left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired ones, they went after Him.

21.verse: Jesus Casts Out a Demon. They Are All Astonished. The News of Him Spreads - And they proceed into Capernaum. And immediately, having entered into the synagogue on the Sabbath, He was teaching.

22.verse: And they were astounded at His teaching, for He was teaching them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.

23.verse: And immediately there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit. And he cried-out,

24.verse: saying “What do we have to do with You, Jesus from-Nazareth? Did You come to destroy us? I know You, Who You are— the Holy One of God!”

25.verse: And Jesus rebuked him, saying “Be silenced and come out of him”.

26.verse: And the unclean spirit, having convulsed him and called-out with a loud voice, came out of him.

27.verse: And they were all astonished, so that they were discussing with themselves, saying “What is this? A new teaching based-on authority! He commands even the unclean spirits and they obey Him!”

28.verse: And the report about Him immediately went out everywhere into the whole surrounding-region of Galilee.

29.verse: That Evening The Whole City of Capernaum Brings Their Sick To Him For Healing - And immediately, having gone out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

30.verse: Now the mother-in-law of Simon was lying-down, being sick-with-fever. And immediately they speak to Him concerning her.

31.verse: And having gone to her, He raised her, having taken-hold-of her hand. And the fever left her and she was serving them.

32.verse: And having become evening, when the sun set, they were bringing to Him all the ones being ill and the ones being demon-possessed.

33.verse: And the whole city was gathered-together at the door.

34.verse: And He cured many being ill with various diseases. And He cast-out many demons, and was not permitting the demons to speak, because they knew Him.

35.verse: And having arisen early-in-the-morning, very late at-night, He went out and went away to a desolate place, and was praying there.

36.verse: And Simon and the ones with him hunted-for Him,

37.verse: and found Him. And they say to Him that “Everyone is seeking You”.

38.verse: And He says to them, “Let us be going elsewhere, into the next towns, in order that I may proclaim there also. For I came-forth for this purpose”.

39.verse: Jesus Heals a Leper, Who Spreads The Word of Him. People Come From All Directions - And He went proclaiming in their synagogues in all Galilee and casting out the demons.

40.verse: And a leper comes to Him, appealing-to Him and kneeling, and saying to Him that “If You are willing, You are able to cleanse me”.

41.verse: And having felt-deep-feelings [of compassion], having stretched-out His hand, He touched him. And He says to him, “I am willing. Be cleansed”.

42.verse: And immediately the leprosy departed from him and he was cleansed.

43.verse: And having sternly-commanded him, He immediately sent him out.

44.verse: And He says to him, “See that you tell no one anything. But go, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them”.

45.verse: But the one, having gone forth, began to proclaim greatly and widely-spread the word, so that He was no longer able to enter openly into a city, but was outside at desolate places. And they were coming to Him from-all-directions.

1.verse: Jesus Heals a Paralytic To Prove He Has Authority To Forgive Sins - And having entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that He was at home.

2.verse: And many were gathered together, so that the house was no longer having-room, not even the places at the door. And He was speaking the word to them.

3.verse: And they come bringing to Him a paralytic being picked-up by four men.

4.verse: And not being able to bring him to Him because of the crowd, they unroofed the roof where He was. And having dug out an opening, they lower the cot on-which the paralytic was lying-down.

5.verse: And Jesus, having seen their faith, says to the paralytic, “Child, your sins are forgiven”.

6.verse: Now some of the scribes were sitting there and reasoning in their hearts,

7.verse: “Why is this One speaking in this manner? He is blaspheming. Who is able to forgive sins except One— God?”

8.verse: And immediately Jesus, having known in His spirit that they were reasoning in this manner within themselves, says to them “Why are you reasoning these things in your hearts?

9.verse: Which is easier— to say to the paralytic ‘Your sins are forgiven’, or to say ‘Arise, and pick-up your cot and walk’?

10.verse: But in order that you may know that the Son of Man has authority to forgive sins on earth”— He says to the paralytic,

11.verse: “I say to you, arise, pick up your cot and go to your house”.

12.verse: And he arose, and immediately having picked-up the cot, went out in front of everyone, so that everyone was astonished and glorifying God, saying that “We never saw anything like this”.

13.verse: Jesus Calls Levi The Tax Collector And Eats With His Friends: I Came For Sinners - And He went out again beside the sea. And all the multitude was coming to Him. And He was teaching them.

14.verse: And while passing on He saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax-office. And He says to him “Be following Me!” And having stood-up, he followed Him.

15.verse: And it comes about that He was reclining [to eat] in his house. And many tax-collectors and sinners were reclining-back-with Jesus and His disciples. For there were many, and they were following Him.

16.verse: And the scribes of the Pharisees, having seen that He was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, were saying to His disciples “Why is it that He is eating with the tax collectors and sinners?”

17.verse: And having heard, Jesus says to them that “The ones being strong have no need of a physician, but the ones being ill. I did not come to call righteous ones, but sinners”.

18.verse: Why Do Your Disciples Not Fast? The Bridegroom Is Here. New Wine Needs New Wineskins - And the disciples of John and the Pharisees were fasting. And they come and say to Him, “For what reason are the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fasting, but Your disciples are not fasting?”

19.verse: And Jesus said to them, “The sons of the wedding-hall cannot be fasting while the bridegroom is with them, can they? As long a time as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot be fasting.

20.verse: But days will come when the bridegroom is taken-away from them, and then they will fast in that day.

21.verse: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise the fullness [of the patch] takes from it— the new from the old— and a worse tear takes place.

22.verse: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the wine will burst the wineskins, and the wine is lost, and the wineskins. But one puts new wine into fresh wineskins”.

23.verse: The Disciples Pluck Grain On The Sabbath. I Am Lord of The Sabbath - And it came about that He was passing through the grainfields on the Sabbath, and His disciples began to make their way while plucking the heads [of grain].

24.verse: And the Pharisees were saying to Him, “Look! Why are they doing on the Sabbath what is not lawful?”

25.verse: And He says to them, “Did you never read [in 1 Sam 21:1-6] what David did when he had a need and was hungry, he and the ones with him—

26.verse: how he entered into the house of God in the time of Abiathar the high-priest and ate the Bread of Presentation which is not lawful for anyone to eat but the priests, and he gave it also to the ones being with him?”

27.verse: And He was saying to them, “The Sabbath was made for the sake of mankind, and not mankind for the sake of the Sabbath.

28.verse: So then, the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath”.

1.verse: Is It Lawful To Heal On The Sabbath? Jesus Heals a Man, Inflaming The Pharisees - And He entered again into the synagogue. And there was a man there having his hand having become-withered.

2.verse: And they were closely-watching Him to see if He would cure him on the Sabbath, in order that they might accuse Him.

3.verse: And He says to the man having the withered hand, “Arise into the middle”.

4.verse: And He says to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do-harm, to save a life or to kill?” But the ones were being silent.

5.verse: And having looked-around-at them with anger, while being deeply-grieved at the hardness of their heart, He says to the man, “Stretch out the hand”. And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored.

6.verse: And having gone out, the Pharisees immediately were giving counsel against Him with the Herodians so that they might destroy Him.

7.verse: A Great Multitude Comes To Jesus To Be Healed - And Jesus withdrew to the sea with His disciples, and a great multitude from Galilee followed. And from Judea,

8.verse: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumea and beyond the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude hearing all that He was doing came to Him.

9.verse: And He said to His disciples that a small-boat should be standing-ready-for Him because of the crowd— in order that they might not be pressing Him.

10.verse: For He cured many, so that they were falling-upon Him in order that all who were having scourges might touch Him.

11.verse: And the unclean spirits, whenever they were seeing Him, were falling-before Him and crying-out, saying that “You are the Son of God”.

12.verse: And He was sternly rebuking them in order that they might not make Him known.

13.verse: The Twelve Are Appointed - And He goes up on the mountain and summons whom He was wanting. And they went to Him.

14.verse: And He appointed twelve, whom He also named apostles, in order that they might be with Him, and in order that He might send them out to proclaim

15.verse: and to have authority to cast out the demons.

16.verse: And He appointed the twelve, even Peter (He put the name on Simon),

17.verse: and James, the son of Zebedee, and John, the brother of James (and He put on them the name Boanerges, which means “sons of thunder”),

18.verse: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James, the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon, the Cananaean,

19.verse: and Judas Iscariot, who also handed Him over.

20.verse: Scribes Say Jesus Uses Satan’s Power. Such Blasphemy of The Spirit Will Not Be Forgiven - And He goes into a house. And the crowd comes-together again, so that they were not even able to eat bread.

21.verse: And having heard-of it, the ones from Him went-forth to take-hold-of  Him. For they were saying that “He lost-His-senses”.

22.verse: And the scribes having come down from Jerusalem were saying that “He has Beelzebul”, and that “He is casting-out the demons by the ruler of the demons”.

23.verse: And having summoned them, He was speaking to them in parables: “How is Satan able to be casting-out Satan?

24.verse: And if a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom is not able to stand;

25.verse: and if a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.

26.verse: And if Satan stood-up against himself and was divided, he is not able to stand, but he has an end.

27.verse: But no one, having entered into the house of the strong man, can plunder his things unless he first binds the strong man. And then he will plunder his house.

28.verse: Truly I say to you that all sins and blasphemies will be forgiven to the sons of humans, whatever they may blaspheme.

29.verse: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit does not have forgiveness forever, but is guilty of an eternal sin”—

30.verse: because they were saying “He has an unclean spirit”.

31.verse: Whoever Does The Will of God Is My Family - And His mother and His brothers come. And while standing outside, they sent-forth a message to Him, calling Him.

32.verse: And a crowd was sitting around Him. And they say to Him, “Behold— Your mother and Your brothers and Your sisters are outside seeking You”.

33.verse: And having responded to them, He says “Who is My mother and My brothers?”

34.verse: And having looked-around-at the ones sitting in a circle around Him, He says “Look— My mother and My brothers!

35.verse: For whoever does the will of God— this one is My brother and sister and mother”.

1.verse: Jesus Teaches The Multitudes In Parables - And again He began to teach beside the sea. And a very large crowd is gathered-together with Him so that He, having gotten into a boat, sits-down in the sea [to teach]. And all the multitude were near the sea on the land.

2.verse: And He was teaching them many things in parables. The Sower’s Seed Falls On Different Kinds of Soil. Only The Good Soil Produces Fruit -And He was saying to them in His teaching,

3.verse: “Listen! Behold— the one sowing went out to sow.

4.verse: And it came about during the sowing that some seed fell along the road. And the birds came and ate it up.

5.verse: And other seed fell on the rocky place where it was not having much soil. And immediately it sprang-up because of not having a depth of soil.

6.verse: And when the sun rose, it was scorched. And because of not having a root, it was dried-up.

7.verse: And other seed fell into the thorns. And the thorns came-up and choked it, and it did not give fruit.

8.verse: And others fell into the good soil, and were giving fruit while coming up and growing. And they were bearing thirty fold and sixty fold and a hundred fold”.

9.verse: And He was saying, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear”.

10.verse: Jesus Tells The Disciples The Purpose of Parables - And when He came-to-be alone, the ones around Him with the twelve were questioning Him as to the parables.

11.verse: And He was saying to them, “The mystery of the kingdom of God has been given to you. But all things come in parables to those outside

12.verse: in order that while seeing, they may be seeing and not perceive, and while hearing, they may be hearing and not understanding, that they may not ever turn-back and it be forgiven them”.

13.verse: Jesus Explains The Parable of The Sower - And He says to them, “Do you not know this parable? And how will you understand all the parables?

14.verse: The one sowing sows the word.

15.verse: Now these people are the ones along the road, where the word is sown. And when they hear, immediately Satan comes and takes away the word having been sown into them.

16.verse: And these people are the ones being sown the seed on the rocky places— who, when they hear the word, immediately are receiving it with joy.

17.verse: And they do not have a root in themselves, but are temporary. Then affliction or persecution having come about because of the word, immediately they are caused-to-fall.

18.verse: And other people are the ones being sown the seed into the thorns. These are the ones having heard the word—

19.verse: and coming-in, the anxieties of the age and the deceitfulness of riches and the desires with respect to the other things are choking the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

20.verse: And those people are the ones having been sown the seed on the good soil, who are hearing the word and accepting it and bearing-fruit— thirty fold and sixty fold and a hundred fold”.

21.verse: The Lamp Comes To Shine, Not To Be Hidden - And He was saying to them, “The lamp does not come in order that it may be put under the basket or under the bed, does it? Is it not in order that it may be put on the lampstand?

22.verse: For it is not hidden, except in order that it may be made-visible. Nor did it become hidden-away, but in order that it may come into visibility.

23.verse: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear”.

24.verse: With The Measure You Use It Will Be Measured To You - And He was saying to them, “Be watching what you listen-to. With what measure you measure, it will be measured to you— and it will be added to you.

25.verse: For he who has— it will be given to him. And he who does not have— even what he has will be taken-away from him”.

26.verse: The Kingdom of God Is Like Seed That Grows From Within Itself To Maturity - And He was saying, “The kingdom of God is like this: as-if a person would throw the seed upon the soil,

27.verse: and would be sleeping and arising night and day, and the seed would be budding and growing-long— how, he does not know.

28.verse: The soil bears-fruit by-itself — first grass, then a head, then a full grain in the head.

29.verse: And whenever the fruit permits, immediately he sends-forth the sickle because the harvest has come”.

30.verse: The Kingdom of God Is Like a Mustard Seed. It Starts Small And Grows Large - And He was saying, “How should we liken the kingdom of God, or with what parable may we present it?—

31.verse: as a seed of a mustard-plant, which when it is sown upon the soil is being smaller than all the seeds upon the soil.

32.verse: And when it is sown, it goes-up and becomes larger than all the garden-plants. And it makes large branches so that the birds of the heaven are able to be nesting under the shade of it”.

33.verse: Jesus Spoke To The Crowd In Parables And Explained Everything To His Disciples - And with many such parables He was speaking the word to them, as they were able to hear it.

34.verse: And He was not speaking to them apart from a parable. But He was explaining everything privately to His own disciples.

35.verse: Jesus Calms The Wind And Sea. The Disciples Say, Who Is This Man? - And on that day, having become evening, He says to them, “Let us go to the other side”.

36.verse: And having left the crowd, they take Him along as He was, in the boat. And other boats were with Him.

37.verse: And a great storm of wind takes place. And the waves were throwing-over into the boat so that the boat was already being filled.

38.verse: And He was in the stern on the cushion, sleeping. And they wake Him and say to Him, “Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”

39.verse: And having awakened, He rebuked the wind, and said to the sea “Be still, be silenced”. And the wind stopped. And there was a great calm.

40.verse: And He said to them, “Why are you afraid? Do you not yet have faith?”

41.verse: And they feared a great fear. And they were saying to one another, “Who then is this One, that even the wind and the sea obey Him?”

1.verse: Jesus Casts Demons Out of a Man Into a Herd of Pigs. The Locals Beg Him To Leave - And they came to the other side of the sea, to the country of the Gerasenes.

2.verse: And He having gone out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met Him, out of the tombs—

3.verse: who was having his dwelling-place in the tombs. And no one was able to bind him any-more, not even with a chain,

4.verse: because he often had been bound with shackles and chains and the chains had been torn-apart by him, and the shackles broken. And no one was strong-enough to subdue him.

5.verse: And continually, by night and by day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying-out and cutting himself with stones.

6.verse: And having seen Jesus from a distance, he ran and prostrated-himself before Him.

7.verse: And having cried-out with a loud voice, he says “What do I have to do with You, Jesus, Son of the Most-High God? I make You swear by God, do not torment me”.

8.verse: For He was saying to him, “Come out of the man, unclean spirit”.

9.verse: And He was asking him, “What is the name for you?” And he says to Him, “The name for me is Legion, because we are many”.

10.verse: And he was begging Him greatly that He not send them outside of the country.

11.verse: Now there was a large herd of pigs feeding there at the mountain.

12.verse: And they begged Him, saying “Send us to the pigs, in order that we may enter into them”.

13.verse: And He permitted them. And the unclean spirits, having come out, entered into the pigs. And the herd, about two-thousand, rushed down the steep-bank into the sea. And they were drowning in the sea.

14.verse: And the ones feeding them fled and reported it in the city and in the fields. And they came to see what the thing having happened was.

15.verse: And they come to Jesus, and see the one being demon-possessed sitting, having been clothed and being sound-minded— the one having had the “legion”. And they became afraid.

16.verse: And the ones having seen it related to them how it happened to the one being demon-possessed, and about the pigs.

17.verse: And they began to beg Him to depart from their districts.

18.verse: And while He was getting into the boat, the one having been demon-possessed was begging Him that he might be with Him.

19.verse: And He did not permit him, but says to him, “Go to your house, to your people, and report to them all-that the Lord has done for you, and that He had mercy on you”.

20.verse: And he departed and began to proclaim in Decapolis all-that Jesus did for him. And they all were marveling.

21.verse: A Synagogue Official Comes To Jesus About His Dying Daughter. Jesus Goes With Him - And Jesus having crossed-over again in the boat to the other side, a large crowd was gathered to Him. And He was beside the sea.

22.verse: And one of the synagogue-officials comes, Jairus by name. And having seen Him, he falls at His feet

23.verse: and begs Him greatly, saying that “My little-daughter is at the point of death. I beg that having come, You lay Your hands on her in order that she may be restored and live”.

24.verse: And He departed with him. And a large crowd was following Him, and they were pressing-upon Him.

25.verse: On The Way, a Woman Touches His Garment And Is Healed Because of Her Faith - And a woman— being in a flow of blood for twelve years,

26.verse: and having suffered many things by many physicians, and having spent everything of hers and not having been benefitted at all, but rather having come to the worse,

27.verse: having heard about Jesus, having come in the crowd from behind— touched His garment.

28.verse: For she was saying that “If I touch even His garments, I will be restored”.

29.verse: And immediately the fountain of her blood was dried-up, and she knew in her body that she had been healed from the scourge.

30.verse: And immediately Jesus— having known in Himself the power having gone forth from Him, having turned around in the crowd— was saying “Who touched My garments?”

31.verse: And His disciples were saying to Him, “You see the crowd pressing-upon You and You say ‘Who touched Me?’”

32.verse: And He was looking around to see the one having done this.

33.verse: And the woman— having become afraid, and while trembling, knowing what had happened to her— came and fell-before Him and told Him the whole truth.

34.verse: And the One said to her, “Daughter, your faith has restored you. Go in peace and be healthy from your scourge”.

35.verse: The Daughter Dies Before Jesus Arrives. He Raises Her From The Dead - While He is still speaking, they come from [the house of] the synagogue-official, saying that “Your daughter died. Why are you troubling the Teacher further?”

36.verse: But Jesus, having ignored the statement being spoken, says to the synagogue-official, “Do not be fearing, only be believing”.

37.verse: And He did not permit anyone to follow with Him except Peter and James and John (the brother of James).

38.verse: And they come to the house of the synagogue official, and He sees a commotion and ones weeping and wailing loudly.

39.verse: And having gone in, He says to them, “Why are you being thrown-into-a-commotion, and weeping? The child did not die, but is sleeping”.

40.verse: And they were laughing-scornfully at Him. But He, having put everyone out, takes along the father of the child and the mother and the ones with Him, and proceeds in where the child was.

41.verse: And having taken hold of the hand of the child, He says to her, “Talitha koum” (which being translated is “Little-girl, I say to you, arise”).

42.verse: And immediately the little girl stood-up and was walking around (for she was twelve years old). And immediately they were astonished with great astonishment.

43.verse: And He gave-orders to them strictly that no one should know this. And He said that something should be given to her to eat.

1.verse: And He went out from there. Jesus Teaches In His Hometown Synagogue. They Are Astounded But Unbelieving -And He comes into His hometown. And His disciples are following Him.

2.verse: And having become Sabbath, He began to teach in the synagogue. And while listening, many were astounded, saying “From where did these things come to this One? And what is the wisdom having been given to this One? And such miracles taking place by His hands!

3.verse: Is this One not the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James and Joses and Jude and Simon? And are not His sisters here with us?” And they were taking-offense at Him.

4.verse: And Jesus was saying to them that “A prophet is not without-honor except in his hometown and among his relatives and in his house”.

5.verse: And He was not able to do any miracle there— except, having laid His hands on a few sick ones, He cured them.

6.verse: And He was marveling because of their unbelief. The Twelve Are Sent Out Two By Two To Proclaim Repentance And Heal The Sick -And He was going-around the villages in a circle, teaching.

7.verse: And He summons the twelve, and began to send them out two by two. And He was giving them authority over the unclean spirits.

8.verse: And He instructed them that they should be taking nothing for the journey except a staff  only— no bread, no [traveler’s] bag, no money for the [money] belt—

9.verse: but should go having [merely] tied-on sandals. “And do not put on two tunics”.

10.verse: And He was saying to them, “Wherever you enter into a house, be staying there until you go forth from-that-place.

11.verse: And whatever place does not welcome you, nor do they listen-to you— while proceeding out from-that-place, shake-out the dirt under your feet for a testimony against them”.

12.verse: And having gone forth, they proclaimed that they should repent.

13.verse: And they were casting out many demons. And they were anointing many sick ones with oil and curing them.

14.verse: Herod Hears of Jesus And Thinks John The Baptist Arose From The Dead - And King Herod heard [of Him], for His name became known. And they were saying that “John, the one baptizing, has arisen from the dead. And for this reason the miraculous-powers are at-work in Him”.

15.verse: And others were saying that “He is Elijah”. And others were saying that “He is a prophet like one of the [former] prophets”.

16.verse: But having heard, Herod was saying, “John whom I beheaded— this one arose”.

17.verse: For Herod Had Beheaded John The Baptist - For Herod himself, having sent out men, seized John and bound him in prison because of Herodias, the wife of Philip his brother— because he married her.

18.verse: For John was saying to Herod that “It is not lawful for you to have the wife of your brother”.

19.verse: And Herodias was hostile to him and wanting to kill him, and was not being able.

20.verse: For Herod was fearing John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man. And he was protecting him. And having heard him, he was greatly perplexed, and-yet he was listening-to him with-pleasure.

21.verse: And an opportune day having come about when Herod, for his birthday-celebrations, made a banquet for his princes and the commanders and the leading ones of Galilee,

22.verse: and his daughter Herodias having come in and danced— she pleased Herod, and the ones reclining-back-with him [to eat]. The king said to the girl, “Ask me whatever you wish and I will give it to you”.

23.verse: And he swore-with-an-oath to her solemnly, “Whatever thing you ask me, I will give it to you— up to half of my kingdom”.

24.verse: And having gone out, she said to her mother, “What should I ask-for?” And the one said, “The head of John, the one baptizing”.

25.verse: And having immediately gone in with haste to the king, she asked, saying “I want you to give me at-once on a platter the head of John the Baptist”.

26.verse: And the king, having become deeply-grieved, did not want to reject her because of the oaths and the ones reclining-back [to eat].

27.verse: And immediately having sent-out an executioner, the king commanded him to bring his head. And having gone, he beheaded him in the prison.

28.verse: And he brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl. And the girl gave it to her mother.

29.verse: And his disciples, having heard-of it, came and took away his corpse and laid it in a tomb.

30.verse: Jesus Multiplies Five Loaves And Two Fish To Feed 5000 Men - And the apostles are gathered-together with Jesus. And they reported to Him all that they did and that they taught.

31.verse: And He says to them, “Come, you yourselves privately, to a desolate place, and rest a little”. For the ones coming and the ones going were many, and they were not even finding-an-opportunity to eat.

32.verse: And they went away privately in the boat to a desolate place.

33.verse: And they saw them going, and many knew where. And they ran there together on foot from all the cities. And they came-ahead-of  them.

34.verse: And having gone out, He saw a large crowd and felt-deep-feelings [of compassion] toward them because they were like sheep not having a shepherd. And He began to teach them many things.

35.verse: And already having become a late hour, having come to Him, His disciples were saying that “This place is desolate, and it is already a late hour.

36.verse: Send them away in order that having gone away into the surrounding farms and villages, they may buy themselves what they may eat”.

37.verse: But the One, having responded, said to them, “You give them something to eat”. And they say to Him, “Should we, having gone away, buy loaves worth two-hundred denarii and give them something to eat?”

38.verse: And the One says to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go, see!” And having come-to-know, they say “Five, and two fish”.

39.verse: And He commanded them to make everyone lie-back party by party on the green grass.

40.verse: And they fell-back grouping by grouping, by hundreds and by fifties.

41.verse: And having taken the five loaves and the two fish, having looked up to heaven, He blessed them, and broke the loaves in pieces, and was giving them to His disciples in order that they might be setting it before them. And He divided the two fish to everyone.

42.verse: And they all ate and were filled-to-satisfaction.

43.verse: And they picked up fragments— the fillings of twelve baskets, and from the fish.

44.verse: And the ones having eaten the loaves were five-thousand men.

45.verse: Jesus Walks Across The Raging Sea - And immediately, He compelled His disciples to get into the boat, and to be going ahead to the other side, toward Bethsaida, while He sends-away the crowd.

46.verse: And having said-good-bye to them, He went away on the mountain to pray.

47.verse: And having become evening, the boat was in the middle of the sea and He was alone on the land.

48.verse: And having seen them being tormented in the rowing— for the wind was contrary to them— He comes to them around the fourth watch of the night, walking on the sea. And He was intending to pass-by them.

49.verse: But the ones, having seen Him walking on the sea, thought that “It is a phantom”, and cried-out.

50.verse: For they all saw Him and were frightened. But immediately the One spoke with them. And He says to them, “Take-courage, I am the One. Do not be afraid”.

51.verse: And He went up with them in the boat. And the wind stopped. And they were very exceedingly astonished in themselves.

52.verse: For they did not understand on the basis of the loaves-of-bread, but their heart had been hardened.

53.verse: In Gennesaret The People Recognize Him And Bring All Their Sick To Him For Healing - And having crossed-over, they came on land in Gennesaret and moored.

54.verse: And they having gone out of the boat— immediately having recognized Him,

55.verse: the people ran around that whole region. And they began to carry around the ones being ill on their cots to-where they were hearing that He was.

56.verse: And wherever He was entering— into villages, or into cities, or into fields— they were laying the ones being sick in the marketplaces, and were begging Him that they might touch even the tassel of His garment. And all who touched it were being restored.

1.verse: Pharisees Object To Eating With Unwashed Hands. Jesus Condemns Their Traditions - And the Pharisees and some of the scribes are gathered-together with Him, having come from Jerusalem.

2.verse: And having seen some of His disciples, that they are eating their bread with defiled hands, that is, unwashed—

3.verse: for the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their hands with a fist, holding-on-to the tradition of the elders.

4.verse: And they do not eat [when they return] from the marketplace unless they cleanse [themselves]. And there are many other traditions which they received to hold-on-to— the cleansing of cups and pitchers and copper-pots and couches.

5.verse: And the Pharisees and the scribes ask Him, “For what reason are Your disciples not walking according to the tradition of the elders, but are eating their bread with defiled hands?”

6.verse: And the One said to them, “Isaiah prophesied rightly concerning you hypocrites, as it has been written [in Isa 29:13], that ‘This people honors Me with their lips, but their heart is far distant from Me.

7.verse: But they are worshiping Me in-vain, teaching as teachings the commandments of humans’.

8.verse: Having neglected the commandment of God, you are holding on to the tradition of humans!”

9.verse: And He was saying to them, “You are nicely setting-aside the commandment of God in order that you may establish your tradition!

10.verse: For Moses said [in Ex 20:12], ‘Be honoring your father and your mother’, and [in Ex 21:17], ‘Let the one speaking-evil-of father or mother come-to-an-end by a death’.

11.verse: But you say if a person says to his father or mother, ‘Whatever you might be benefitted from me is Corban (which means “Gift”)’,

12.verse: you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or mother—

13.verse: nullifying the word of God by your tradition which you handed-down. And you are doing many similar such things”.

14.verse: And having summoned the crowd again, He was saying to them, “Everyone listen-to Me and understand—

15.verse: there is nothing outside of the person proceeding into him which is able to defile him. But the things proceeding out of the person are the things defiling the person.

17.verse: What Goes Into The Body Does Not Defile, But What Comes Out of The Heart - And when He entered into a house away-from the crowd, His disciples were questioning Him as to the parable.

18.verse: And He says to them, “So are even you without-understanding? Do you not perceive that everything outside proceeding into the person is not able to defile him

19.verse: because it does not proceed into his heart, but into his stomach, and it proceeds out into the latrine?” (He was making all foods clean.)

20.verse: And He was saying that “The thing proceeding out of the person— that defiles the person.

21.verse: For from within, out of the heart of people, proceed the evil thoughts, sexual-immoralities, thefts, murders,

22.verse: adulteries, greeds, evils, deceit, sensuality, an evil eye, blasphemy, arrogance, foolishness.

23.verse: All these evil things proceed-out from within, and defile the person”.

24.verse: A Gentile Woman Begs For Crumbs From The Master’s Table - And having arisen, He went from there to the districts of Tyre. And having entered into a house, He was wanting no one to know it. And-yet He was not able to escape-notice.

25.verse: But immediately, a woman having heard about Him— of whom her little daughter was having an unclean spirit— having come, fell at His feet.

26.verse: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syro-Phoenician by nationality. And she was asking Him that He cast out the demon from her daughter.

27.verse: And He was saying to her, “First allow the children to be filled-to-satisfaction. For it is not good to take the bread of the children and throw it to the little-dogs”.

28.verse: But the one responded and says to Him, “Master, even the little dogs under the table eat from the crumbs of the children!”

29.verse: And He said to her, “Because of this statement, go— the demon has gone out of your daughter”.

30.verse: And having gone to her house, she found the child having been put on the bed, and the demon having gone out.

31.verse: Jesus Heals a Deaf-Mute - And again having gone out of the districts of Tyre, He went through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee in the midst of the districts of Decapolis.

32.verse: And they bring to Him a deaf and speech-impaired one, and are begging Him that He lay His hand on him.

33.verse: And having taken him away from the crowd privately, He put His fingers into his ears. And having spit, He touched his tongue.

34.verse: And having looked up to heaven, He sighed. And He says to him “Ephphatha”, which means “Be opened”.

35.verse: And immediately his ears were opened and the binding of his tongue was released and he was speaking correctly.

36.verse: And He gave-orders to them that they should be telling no one. But as much as He was giving orders to them, they even more abundantly were proclaiming it.

37.verse: And they were being super-abundantly astounded, saying “He has done all things well. He even makes the deaf to hear and the mute to speak”.

1.verse: Jesus Again Multiplies Loaves And Fish To Feed 4000 - In those days, there again being a large crowd, and they not having anything they might eat— having summoned the disciples, He says to them

2.verse: “I feel-deep-feelings [of compassion] toward the crowd because it is already three days they are remaining-with Me, and they do not have anything they may eat.

3.verse: And if I send them away to their house hungry, they will become-exhausted on the way. And some of them have come from a distance”.

4.verse: And His disciples responded to Him that “From where will anyone be able to fill these ones to satisfaction with bread here in a desolate-place?”

5.verse: And He was asking them, “How many loaves do you have?” And the ones said “Seven”.

6.verse: And He orders the crowd to fall-back on the ground [to eat]. And having taken the seven loaves, having given-thanks, He broke them, and was giving them to His disciples in order that they might be setting them before them. And they set them before the crowd.

7.verse: And they had a few small-fish. And having blessed them, He said to be setting these also before them.

8.verse: And they ate and were filled-to-satisfaction. And they picked up the leftovers of fragments— seven large-baskets.

9.verse: And there were about four-thousand men. And He sent them away.

10.verse: The Pharisees Ask For a Sign. No Sign Will Be Given To This Generation - And immediately, having gotten into the boat with His disciples, He went to the regions of Dalmanutha.

11.verse: And the Pharisees came out and began to debate with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven, testing Him.

12.verse: And having sighed-deeply in His spirit, He says “Why is this generation seeking a sign? Truly I say to you, a sign will never be given to this generation”.

13.verse: Jesus Warns The Disciples To Beware of The Leaven of The Pharisees - And having left them, having again gotten into the boat, He went to the other side.

14.verse: And they forgot to take bread. And except one loaf, they were not having any with them in the boat.

15.verse: And He was giving orders to them, saying “Watch out! Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and the leaven of Herod”.

16.verse: And they were discussing with one another that they did not have bread.

17.verse: And having known it, He says to them “Why are you discussing that you do not have bread? Do you not yet perceive nor understand? Do you have your heart hardened?

18.verse: Having eyes, are you not seeing? And having ears, are you not hearing? And do you not remember?—

19.verse: When I broke the five loaves for the five-thousand, how many full baskets of fragments did you pick up?” They say to Him, “Twelve”.

20.verse: “When I broke the seven loaves for the four-thousand, the fillings of how many large-baskets of fragments did you pick up?” And they say to Him, “Seven”.

21.verse: And He was saying to them, “Do you not yet understand?”

22.verse: Jesus Heals a Blind Man In Two Stages - And they come to Bethsaida. And they bring Him a blind man, and are begging Him that He touch him.

23.verse: And having taken-hold-of the hand of the blind man, He brought him outside of the village. And having spit in his eyes, having laid His hands on him, He was asking him “Do you see anything?”

24.verse: And having looked-up, he was saying “I am seeing people, because I am looking-at something like trees walking around”.

25.verse: Then again He laid His hands on his eyes, and looked-intently, and restored them. And he was seeing everything clearly.

26.verse: And He sent him away to his house, saying “Do not even enter into the village”.

27.verse: Who Do You Disciples Say That I Am? Peter Says, You Are The Messiah - And Jesus and His disciples went forth into the villages of Philip’s Caesarea. And on the way, He was questioning His disciples, saying to them “Who do people say that I am?”

28.verse: And the ones spoke to Him, saying “That You are John the Baptist. And others, Elijah. But others, that You are one of the prophets”.

29.verse: And He was questioning them, “But who do you say that I am?” Having responded, Peter says to Him “You are the Christ”.

30.verse: And He warned them that they should be telling no one about Him.

31.verse: Jesus Began To Teach Them That He Must Die And Be Raised. Peter Rebukes Him - And He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and be killed, and rise-up after three days.

32.verse: And He was stating the matter with openness. And Peter, having taken Him aside, began to rebuke Him.

33.verse: But the One, having turned around, and having looked-at His disciples, rebuked Peter. And He says “Get behind Me, Satan— because you are not thinking the things of God, but the things of humans”.

34.verse: Deny Yourself, Take Up Your Cross, And Follow Me. Some Here Will See My Kingdom - And having summoned the crowd with His disciples, He said to them, “If anyone wants to be following after Me, let him deny himself  and take up his cross, and be following Me.

35.verse: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it. But whoever will lose his life for the sake of Me and the good-news will save it.

36.verse: For what does it profit a person to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?

37.verse: For what might a person give in-exchange-for his life?

38.verse: For whoever is ashamed-of Me and My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels”.

1.verse: And He was saying to them, “Truly I say to you that there are some of the ones standing here who will by-no-means taste death until they see the kingdom of God having come in power”.

2.verse: Three Disciples See Jesus Transformed, And Hear God Tell Them To Listen To Jesus - And after six days, Jesus takes along Peter and James and John, and brings them up on a high mountain privately, alone. And He was transfigured in front of them.

3.verse: And His garments became shining, very white, such as a bleacher on earth is not able to make so white.

4.verse: And Elijah appeared to them, with Moses. And they were talking-with Jesus.

5.verse: And having responded, Peter says to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good that we are here. And let us make three dwellings— one for You and one for Moses and one for Elijah”.

6.verse: For he did not know what he should respond, for they became terrified.

7.verse: And there came-to-be a cloud overshadowing them. And a voice came out of the cloud: “This is My beloved Son. Be listening-to Him”.

8.verse: And suddenly, having looked around, they no longer saw anyone with themselves but Jesus alone.

9.verse: The Disciples Ask, Wasn’t Elijah Supposed To Come Before The Messiah? - And while they were coming down from the mountain, He gave orders to them that they should relate to no one the things which they saw, except when the Son of Man rises-up from the dead.

10.verse: And they held the matter to themselves, discussing what the ‘rising-up from the dead’ meant.

11.verse: And they were questioning Him, saying “Why is it that the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

12.verse: And the One said to them, “Elijah, having come first, restores all things— and-yet how has it been written for the Son of Man that He would suffer many things and be treated-with-contempt?

13.verse: But I say to you that Elijah indeed has come, and they did to him whatever they were wanting, just as it has been written for him”.

14.verse: A Father Pleads With Jesus To Heal His Son Whom The Disciples Could Not Heal - And having come to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them, and scribes debating with them.

15.verse: And immediately all the multitude, having seen Him, were struck-with-wonder. And running-up, they were greeting Him.

16.verse: And He asked them, “What are you debating with them?”

17.verse: And one from the crowd answered Him, “Teacher, I brought my son having a mute spirit to You.

18.verse: And wherever it overcomes him, it throws-him-to-the-ground, and he foams-at-the-mouth and grinds his teeth and becomes-stiff. And I spoke to Your disciples in order that they might cast it out, and they were not strong-enough ”.

19.verse: And the One, having responded to them, says “O unbelieving generation, how long will I be with you? How long will I bear-with you? Bring him to Me”.

20.verse: And they brought him to Him. And having seen Him, the spirit immediately convulsed him. And having fallen on the ground, he was rolling-himself while foaming-at-the-mouth.

21.verse: And He asked his father, “How long is it since this has happened to him?” And the one said, “From childhood.

22.verse: And it often threw him even into fire and into waters in order that it might destroy him. But if You are able to do anything, help us, having felt-deep-feelings [of pity] toward us”.

23.verse: And Jesus said to him, “‘If You are able?’ All things are possible for the one believing”.

24.verse: Immediately, having cried-out, the father of the child was saying, “I believe. Help my unbelief ”.

25.verse: And Jesus, having seen that a crowd is running-together-upon them, rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it “Mute and deaf spirit, I command you— come out of him and enter into him no longer”.

26.verse: And having cried-out, and having convulsed him greatly, it came out. And he became as if dead, so that the majority were saying that “He died”.

27.verse: But Jesus, having taken hold of his hand, raised him. And he stood-up.

28.verse: And He having entered into a house, His disciples were questioning Him privately, “Why is it that we were not able to cast it out?”

29.verse: And He said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing except by prayer”.

30.verse: Jesus Again Teaches His Disciples That He Must Die And Be Raised - And having gone forth from there, they were passing through Galilee. And He was not wanting anyone to know it.

31.verse: For He was teaching His disciples, and saying to them that “The Son of Man is being handed-over into the hands of men. And they will kill Him. And having been killed, He will rise-up after three days”.

32.verse: But the ones were not-understanding the statement, and they were fearing to question Him.

33.verse: The Disciples Argue About Who Is The Greatest. Jesus Says, To Be First You Must Be Last - And they came to Capernaum. And having come-to-be in the house, He was questioning them, “What were you discussing on the way?”

34.verse: But the ones were being silent. For on the way they argued with one another who was greater.

35.verse: And having sat-down, He called the twelve. And He says to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all”.

36.verse: Whoever Welcomes a Child In My Name Welcomes Me - And having taken a child, He stood him in the middle of them. And having taken him in His arms, He said to them,

37.verse: “Whoever welcomes one such-as-these children on the basis of My name, welcomes Me. And whoever welcomes Me does not [merely] welcome Me, but the One having sent Me forth”.

38.verse: John Recalls an Instance When The Disciples Did Not Welcome Someone - John said to Him, “Teacher, we saw someone casting-out demons in Your name. And we were forbidding him because he was not following us”.

39.verse: But Jesus said, “Do not be forbidding him. For there is no one who will do a miracle on the basis of My name, and soon be able to speak-evil-of Me.

40.verse: For he who is not against us is for us.

41.verse: For whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in the name that you are Christ’s— truly I say to you that he will by no means lose his reward.

42.verse: Whoever Causes One of These Little Ones To Fall Would Be Better Off Dead - “And whoever causes one of these little ones believing in Me to fall— it would be better for him if instead a donkey’s millstone were lying around his neck, and he had been thrown into the sea.

43.verse: Better To Remove Whatever Causes You To Fall Than To Go Into Hell - And if your hand should be causing you to fall, cut it off. It is better that you enter into life crippled than go into Gehenna having two hands— into the inextinguishable fire.

45.verse: And if your foot should be causing you to fall, cut it off. It is better that you enter into life lame than be thrown into Gehenna having two feet.

47.verse: And if your eye should be causing you to fall, throw it out. It is better that you enter into the kingdom of God one-eyed than be thrown into Gehenna having two eyes—

48.verse: where their worm does not come-to-an-end, and the fire is not quenched.

49.verse: For everyone will be salted with fire.

50.verse: Have Salt In Yourselves, And Live In Peace - “Salt is good. But if the salt should become unsalty, with what will you season it? Be having salt in yourselves, and be living-in-peace with one another”.

1.verse: Jesus Goes Into Judea. The Crowds Come To Him And He Teaches Them - And having arisen, He goes from there into the districts of Judea and beyond the Jordan. And crowds again are coming-together to Him. And as He was accustomed, He again was teaching them.

2.verse: Pharisees Test Jesus With a Question About Divorce. Divorce Is Not God’s Plan - And Pharisees having come to Him were asking Him if it is lawful for a husband to send-away a wife— testing Him.

3.verse: And the One, having responded, said to them, “What did Moses command you?”

4.verse: And the ones said, “Moses permitted us to write a certificate of divorce and send her away”.

5.verse: But Jesus said to them, “He wrote this commandment to you because-of your hardness-of-heart.

6.verse: But from the beginning of creation, ‘He made them male and female’ [Gen 1:27].

7.verse: ‘For this reason, a man will leave-behind his father and mother and will be joined to his wife.

8.verse: And the two will be one flesh’ [Gen 2:24]. So then, they are no longer two, but one flesh.

9.verse: Therefore what God paired-together, let a person not separate”.

10.verse: And the disciples were questioning Him again about this in the house,

11.verse: and He says to them, “Whoever sends-away his wife and marries another is committing-adultery against her.

12.verse: And if she, having sent-away her husband, marries another, she is committing-adultery”.

13.verse: Jesus Blesses The Children. Of Such Is The Kingdom of God - And they were bringing children to Him in order that He might touch them. But the disciples rebuked them.

14.verse: But Jesus, having seen it, was indignant and said to them, “Permit the children to be coming to Me. Do not be forbidding them. For the kingdom of God is of such ones.

15.verse: Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will never enter into it”.

16.verse: And having taken them in His arms, He was blessing them, while laying His hands on them.

17.verse: A Rich Man Asks What To Do To Enter Heaven. Sell Everything And Follow Me - And while He was proceeding out on the road, one having run up and knelt-before Him was asking Him, “Good Teacher, what should I do in order that I may inherit eternal life?”

18.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good except One— God.

19.verse: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder, do not commit-adultery, do not steal, do not give-false-testimony, do not defraud, be honoring your father and mother’”

20.verse: And the one said to Him, “Teacher, I kept these all from my youth”.

21.verse: And Jesus, having looked at him, loved him. And He said to him, “One thing is lacking as to you: Go, sell all-that you have and give it to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. And come, be following Me”.

22.verse: But the one, having become downcast at His word, went away grieving. For he was having many properties.

23.verse: It Is Hard For The Rich To Enter. But All Who Leave Anything Will Inherit More - And having looked around, Jesus says to His disciples, “How difficultly the ones having wealth will enter into the kingdom of God”.

24.verse: And the disciples were astonished at His words. But Jesus, having responded again, says to them, “Children, how difficult it is to enter into the kingdom of God.

25.verse: It is easier that a camel go through the hole of the needle than that a rich one enter into the kingdom of God”.

26.verse: And the ones were even more astounded, saying to themselves, “Who indeed can be saved?”

27.verse: Having looked at them, Jesus says, “With humans it is impossible, but not with God. For all things are possible with God”.

28.verse: Peter began to say to Him, “Behold— we left everything, and have followed You”.

29.verse: Jesus said, “Truly I say to you, there is no one who left house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for the sake of Me and for the sake of the good-news

30.verse: except he receive a hundred-fold now in this time— houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and fields, along-with persecutions— and in the coming age, eternal life.

31.verse: But many first ones will be last, and the last ones, first”.

32.verse: Jesus Predicts His Death And Resurrection For The Third Time - And they were on the road going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going-ahead-of them. And they were astonished. And the ones following were fearing. And having again taken aside the twelve, He began to tell them the things going-to happen to Him,

33.verse: that “Behold— we are going up to Jerusalem. And the Son of Man will be handed-over to the chief priests and the scribes. And they will condemn Him to death, and will hand Him over to the Gentiles.

34.verse: And they will mock Him and spit-on Him and whip Him and kill Him. And after three days, He will rise-up”.

35.verse: Two Disciples Jockey For Position In The Kingdom. He Says, It Is Not Mine To Give - And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, approach Him, saying to Him, “Teacher, we want You to do for us whatever we ask You”.

36.verse: And the One said to them, “What do you want Me to do for you?”

37.verse: And the ones said to Him, “Grant to us that we may sit one on Your right side and one on the left side in Your glory”.

38.verse: But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup which I drink, or to be baptized the baptism which I am baptized?”

39.verse: And the ones said to Him, “We are able”. And Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup which I drink. And you will be baptized the baptism which I am baptized.

40.verse: But the sitting on My right side or on the left side is not Mine to give, but it is for whom it has been prepared”.

41.verse: Whoever Wants To Be First Shall Be Your Slave. Even I Came To Serve - And having heard-of it, the ten began to be indignant about James and John.

42.verse: And having summoned them, Jesus says to them, “You know that the ones having-the-reputation-of  being rulers of the Gentiles are lording-over them, and their great ones are exercising-authority-over them.

43.verse: But it is not so among you. But whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant,

44.verse: and whoever wants to be first among you shall be slave of all.

45.verse: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many”.

46.verse: Blind Bartimaeus Calls Upon The Messiah To Heal Him - And they come to Jericho. And while He and His disciples and a considerable crowd are proceeding-out from Jericho, Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting beside the road.

47.verse: And having heard that it was Jesus from-Nazareth, he began to cry-out and say, “Son of David, Jesus, have-mercy-on me”.

48.verse: And many were rebuking him in order that he might keep-silent. But the one was crying-out by much more, “Son of David, have mercy on me”.

49.verse: And having stopped, Jesus said, “Call him”. And they call the blind one, saying to him, “Take-courage, arise, He is calling you!”

50.verse: And the one, having thrown-off his cloak, having jumped-up, came to Jesus.

51.verse: And having responded to him, Jesus said, “What do you want Me to do for you?” And the blind one said to Him, “Rabboni— that I may see-again!”

52.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Go. Your faith has restored you”. And immediately he saw-again. And he was following Him on the road.

1.verse: Jesus Rides Into Jerusalem On a Donkey To Shouts of Hosanna - And when they draw-near to Jerusalem— to Bethphage and Bethany, near the Mount of Olives— He sends-forth two of His disciples,

2.verse: and says to them, “Go to the village before you. And immediately while proceeding into it, you will find a colt having been tied, on which none of mankind yet sat. Untie it, and be bringing it.

3.verse: And if someone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’, say, ‘The Lord has need of it, and immediately He sends it back here’”.

4.verse: And they went and found a colt having been tied at a door, outside on the street. And they untie it.

5.verse: And some of the ones standing there were saying to them, “What are you doing untying the colt?”

6.verse: But the ones spoke to them just as Jesus spoke, and they permitted them. And they bring the colt to Jesus.

7.verse: And they throw their cloaks on it, and He sat on it.

8.verse: And many spread their cloaks on the road. And others spread leafy-branches, having cut them from the fields.

9.verse: And the ones going ahead and the ones following were crying-out “Hosanna! Blessed is the One coming in the name of the Lord.

10.verse: Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David. Hosanna in the highest [heavens]!”

11.verse: Jesus Enters Jerusalem - And He entered into Jerusalem, into the temple. And having looked-around-at everything, the hour being already late, He went out to Bethany with the twelve.

12.verse: Jesus Curses a Fruitless Fig Tree - And on the next day, they having departed from Bethany, He was hungry.

13.verse: And having seen from a distance a fig-tree having leaves, He went to see if perhaps He would find anything on it. And having come to it, He found nothing except leaves— for it was not the season for figs.

14.verse: And having responded, He said to it, “May no one eat fruit from you any longer— forever!” And His disciples were listening.

15.verse: Jesus Cleanses The Temple of Merchandisers. The Priests Seek To Destroy Him - And they come into Jerusalem. And having entered into the temple, He began to throw-out the ones selling and the ones buying in the temple. And He overturned the tables of the money-changers, and the seats of the ones selling doves.

16.verse: And He was not permitting that anyone carry an object through the temple.

17.verse: And He was teaching and saying to them, “Has it not been written [in Isa 56:7] that ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? But you have made it a den of robbers”.

18.verse: And the chief priests and the scribes heard it. And they were seeking how they might destroy Him. For they were fearing Him, for the whole crowd was astounded at His teaching.

19.verse: And when it became evening, they were going outside of the city.

20.verse: Lessons From The Fig Tree - And while passing by early-in-the-morning, they saw the fig tree having dried-up from the roots.

21.verse: And having remembered, Peter says to Him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which You cursed has dried-up”.

22.verse: And having responded, Jesus says to them, “Be having faith in God.

23.verse: Truly I say to you that whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and be thrown into the sea’, and does not doubt in his heart, but is believing that what he is speaking is coming-about, it will happen for him.

24.verse: For this reason I say to you, be believing that you received all that you are praying and asking, and it will happen for you.

25.verse: And whenever you stand praying, forgive— if you have anything against anyone— in order that your Father in the heavens also may forgive you your trespasses”.

27.verse: Priests Ask, By What Authority Do You Do This? From Where Was John’s Authority? - And they come again into Jerusalem. And while He is walking around in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders come to Him.

28.verse: And they were saying to Him, “By what-kind-of  authority are You doing these things, or who gave You this authority that you may be doing these things?”

29.verse: And Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing, and you answer Me, and I will tell you by what kind of authority I am doing these things:

30.verse: Was the baptism of John from heaven or from humans? Answer Me!”

31.verse: And they were discussing it with themselves, saying, “If we say ‘From heaven’, He will say ‘Then for what reason did you not believe him?’

32.verse: But should we say ‘From humans’?” They were fearing the crowd, for they all were holding as to John that he really was a prophet.

33.verse: And having responded to Jesus, they say “We do not know”. And Jesus says to them, “Nor am I telling you by what kind of authority I am doing these things”.

1.verse: You Priests Are Like Farmers Who Killed The Owner’s Messengers And His Son - And He began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard and put a fence around it and dug a pit [for a wine press] and built a tower. And he rented it to farmers and went-on-a-journey.

2.verse: And he sent forth a slave to the farmers at the harvest time in order that he might receive from the fruits of the vineyard from the farmers.

3.verse: And having taken him, they beat him, and sent him away empty-handed.

4.verse: And again he sent-forth another slave to them. And that one they struck-on-the-head, and dishonored.

5.verse: And he sent forth another— and that one they killed— and many others, they beating some and killing others.

6.verse: He was still having one to send: a beloved son. He sent him forth to them last, saying that ‘They will have-regard-for my son’.

7.verse: But those farmers said to themselves that ‘This one is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours’.

8.verse: And having taken him, they killed him and threw him outside of the vineyard.

9.verse: Therefore what will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and give the vineyard to others.

10.verse: But As The Psalm Says, The Stone The Builders Rejected Became The Cornerstone - Did you not even read this Scripture [in Ps 118:22-23]: ‘The stone which the ones building rejected, this became the head of the corner.

11.verse: This came about from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

12.verse: And they were seeking to seize Him. And they feared the crowd. For they knew that He spoke the parable against them. And having left Him, they went away.

13.verse: The Pharisees Try To Snare Jesus: Shall We Pay Taxes To Caesar? - And they send forth some of the Pharisees and the Herodians to Him in order that they might catch Him in a statement.

14.verse: And having come, they say to Him, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful. And You are not concerned about [pleasing] anyone, for You do not look at the face of people, but You teach the way of God in accordance with truth. Is it lawful to give a poll-tax to Caesar, or not? Should we give it, or should we not give it?”

15.verse: But the One, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why are you testing Me? Bring Me a denarius in order that I may see it”.

16.verse: And the ones brought it. And He says to them, “Whose is this image and inscription?” And the ones said to Him, “Caesar’s”.

17.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Give back the things of Caesar to Caesar, and the things of God to God”. And they were marveling-greatly at Him.

18.verse: Sadducees Question Jesus About The Resurrection of a Wife With Seven Husbands - And Sadducees come to Him, who say that there is not a resurrection. And they were questioning Him, saying

19.verse: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us [in Deut 25:5] that if a brother of someone dies and leaves-behind a wife and does not leave a child, that his brother should take the wife, and raise-up-from her a seed for his brother.

20.verse: There were seven brothers. And the first took a wife, and dying, did not leave a seed.

21.verse: And the second took her, and died, not having left-behind a seed. And the third similarly.

22.verse: And the seven did not leave a seed. Last of all, the woman also died.

23.verse: In the resurrection when they rise up, of which of them will she be the wife? For the seven had her as wife”.

24.verse: Jesus said to them, “Are you not mistaken because of this— not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?

25.verse: For when they rise-up from the dead, they neither marry nor are they given-in-marriage, but they are like angels in the heavens.

26.verse: And concerning the dead, that they are raised, did you not read in the book of Moses at the [place about the burning] bush, how God spoke to him, saying [in Ex 3:15] ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?

27.verse: He is not God of dead ones, but of living ones. You are greatly mistaken”.

28.verse: A Scribe Asks, Which Is The Foremost Commandment? - And having come to Him, one of the scribes— having heard them debating, having seen that He answered them well— asked Him, “Which is the foremost commandment of all?”

29.verse: Jesus answered that “Foremost is: ‘Hear, Israel. The Lord our God is one Lord.

30.verse: And you shall love the Lord your God from your whole heart, and from your whole soul, and from your whole mind, and from your whole strength’ [Deut 6:4-5].

31.verse: Second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself’ [Lev 19:18]. There is not another commandment greater than these”.

32.verse: And the scribe said to Him, “Well said, Teacher! In accordance with [God’s] truth, You said that He is one. And there is not another except Him.

33.verse: And the statement ‘to love Him from the whole heart, and from the whole understanding, and from the whole strength’, and the statement ‘to love the neighbor as himself’, are more [important] than all the whole-burnt-offerings and sacrifices”.

34.verse: And Jesus, having looked-at him because he responded thoughtfully, said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God”. Jesus Asks How The Messiah Can Be The Son of David Since David Calls Him His Lord -And no one was daring to question Him any more.

35.verse: And having responded, Jesus was saying while teaching in the temple, “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?

36.verse: David himself said by the Holy Spirit [in Ps 110:1], ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Be sitting on My right side until I put Your enemies under Your feet”’.

37.verse: David himself calls Him ‘Lord’. And in what way is He his son?” Jesus Warns The Crowds To Beware of The Scribes -And the large crowd was listening-to Him with-pleasure.

38.verse: And in His teaching He was saying, “Beware of the scribes— the ones delighting to walk around in robes, and to receive greetings in the marketplaces,

39.verse: and seats-of-honor in the synagogues, and places-of-honor at the banquets.

40.verse: They are the ones devouring the houses of the widows, and praying long for a pretense. These ones will receive greater condemnation”.

41.verse: Jesus Uses The Widow’s Offering To Illustrate True Giving - And having sat-down opposite the treasury, He was observing how the crowd throws money into the treasury. And many rich ones were throwing much money.

42.verse: And one poor widow having come threw two leptos, which is a quadrans.

43.verse: And having summoned His disciples, He said to them, “Truly I say to you that this poor widow threw more than all the ones throwing into the treasury.

44.verse: For they all threw out of the money abounding to them. But this one, out of her need, threw all that she was having— her whole living”.

1.verse: Jesus Tells The Disciples That The Temple Will Be Destroyed. They Ask, When? - And while He is proceeding out of the temple, one of His disciples says to Him, “Teacher, look! What stones and what buildings!”

2.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? A stone upon a stone will by no means be left here which will by-any-means not be torn-down”.

3.verse: And while He was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew were questioning Him privately,

4.verse: “Tell us— when will these things happen? And what will be the sign when all these things are about to be accomplished?”

5.verse: And Jesus began to say to them: There Will Be Birthpangs, So Watch Out. The Gospel Must First Reach All The Nations -“Be watching out that no one may deceive you.

6.verse: Many will come on the basis of My name, saying that ‘I am the One’. And they will deceive many.

7.verse: And whenever you hear-of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. They must take place, but it is not yet the end.

8.verse: For nation will arise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines. These things are a beginning of birth-pains.

9.verse: But you— be watching yourselves. They will hand you over to councils. And you will be beaten in synagogues. And you will be stood before governors and kings for My sake, for a testimony to them.

10.verse: And the good-news must first be proclaimed to all the nations.

11.verse: And whenever they lead you while handing you over, do not be anxious-beforehand as to what you should speak. But whatever is given to you in that hour, speak this. For you are not the ones speaking, but the Holy Spirit.

12.verse: And brother will hand-over brother to death, and a father his child. And children will rise-up-in-rebellion against parents, and they will put them to death.

13.verse: And you will be being hated by all because of My name. But the one having endured to the end— this one will be saved.

14.verse: When You See The Abomination of Desolation, Flee. For a Great Affliction Will Occur - “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where he should not (let the one reading understand), then let the ones in Judea be fleeing to the mountains.

15.verse: And let the one upon the housetop not go down nor go in to take anything out of his house.

16.verse: And let the one in the field not turn-back to the things behind to take his cloak.

17.verse: And woe to the ones having a child in the womb, and to the ones nursing in those days.

18.verse: And be praying that it may not take place in winter.

19.verse: For those days will be an affliction such-as has not taken place such-as-this since the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will take place [again].

20.verse: And if the Lord had not shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved. But He shortened the days for the sake of the chosen ones whom He chose.

21.verse: And then if someone says to you, ‘Look— here is the Christ’, ‘Look— there He is’, do not be believing it.

22.verse: For false-christs and false-prophets will arise, and will give signs and wonders so-as to be leading-astray, if possible, the chosen ones.

23.verse: But you be watching out. I have told you everything beforehand.

24.verse: After That Affliction, The Powers Will Be Shaken. Then I Will Come In Glory - “But in those days after that affliction, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its glow,

25.verse: and the stars will be falling from the heaven, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.

26.verse: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

27.verse: And at that time He will send out the angels, and He will gather together His chosen ones from the four winds, from the end of the earth to the end of the heaven.

28.verse: The Parable of The Fig Tree: When You See These Things, You Know I Am Near - “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: when its branch already becomes tender and grows-out its leaves, you know that the summer is near.

29.verse: So also you— when you see these things taking place, you know that He is near, at the doors.

30.verse: Truly I say to you that this generation will by no means pass away until which time these things all take place.

31.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will by-no-means pass away.

32.verse: But No One Knows The Day Or Hour, So Keep Watching - “But no one knows about that day or the hour— not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son— except the Father.

33.verse: Be watching out, be keeping-alert, for you do not know when the time is.

34.verse: It is like a man away-on-a-journey. Having left his house and having given authority to his slaves— to each as to his work— he also commanded the doorkeeper that he should be keeping-watch.

35.verse: Therefore, keep watching— for you do not know when the master of the house is coming, whether evening or midnight or rooster-crowing or early-morning—

36.verse: that having come suddenly, he may not find you sleeping.

37.verse: And what I say to you I say to everyone: ‘Keep watching’”.

1.verse: The Priests Plot To Seize And Kill Jesus - Now the Passover [Feast] and the Feast of Unleavened-Bread was after two days. And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how, having seized Him by deceit, they might kill Him.

2.verse: For they were saying, “Not during the Feast, so that there will not perhaps be an uproar of the people”.

3.verse: Jesus Is Anointed With Oil In Preparation For His Burial - And He being in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, while He is reclining [to eat], a woman came having an alabaster-jar of very-precious genuine nard perfume. Having broken the alabaster-jar, she poured it down over His head.

4.verse: But some were being indignant to themselves— “For what purpose has this waste of perfume taken place?

5.verse: For this perfume could have been sold for over three-hundred denarii and given to the poor”. And they were sternly-scolding her.

6.verse: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you causing troubles for her? She worked a good work in Me.

7.verse: For you always have the poor with you. And whenever you want, you are able to do good for them. But you do not always have Me.

8.verse: She did what she had. She anticipated to perfume My body for its preparation-for-burial.

9.verse: And truly I say to you, wherever the good-news is proclaimed in the whole world, what this one did will also be spoken for a memorial of her”.

10.verse: Judas Betrays Jesus To The Priests - And Judas Iscariot, the one from the twelve, went to the chief priests in order that he might hand Him over to them.

11.verse: And the ones, having heard, rejoiced and promised to give him money. And he was seeking how he might conveniently hand Him over.
